citeinfo.origin: USDOI - BLM - Nevada State Office - Mapping Sciences
citeinfo.title: Land Status Nevada (poly)

descript.abstract: This data is designed to display the distribution of land ownership throughout Nevada, and should be used in conjunction with the Standard Ownership Color Model available through the BLM National Science and Technology Center (NSTC). http://www.blm.gov/nstc/mapstandards/index.html This data was originally captured for the Bureau of Land Management by the University of Utah, for use with the U.S. Fish and Wildlife GAP Program. The data was updated using GCDB in 2003.
descript.purpose: It is intended to be used as a supplemental polygon layer representing and identifying landownership status and boundaries of BLM, private, and other public lands.
descript.supplinf: Further information for this coverage may be found through the University of Utah.

idinfo.accconst: Although this data is made available by the BLM Nevada State Office, no liability is assumed for the current accuracy or utility of the data on any system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty for individual or aggregate data use with other data. The BLM shall not be held liable for improper use of the data described and/or contained herein. By using this data you hereby agree to these conditions.

idinfo.datacred: University of Utah USDOI - Bureau of Land Management Patt Case

secinfo.sechandl: This data layer contains unclassified information and does not contain sensitive information that might be withheld under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA)

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.2.1350

dataqual.logic: Polygon topology present. Polygons are closed and have unique values based on ownership status.
dataqual.complete: The data for this layer represents landownership boundary status within the state of Nevada.

procstep.procdesc: This data was originally captured for the Bureau of Land Management by the University of Utah, for use with the U.S. Fish and Wildlife GAP Program. The data is a digitized polygon layer from 1:100,000 mylar base maps supplied to the University of Utah by the BLM. Further metadata for this coverage may be found at the University of Utah web site: http://www.its.state.ut.us/agrc/html/subject.html
The Elko County coverage was updated by the BLM - Nevada State Office in Fall 1998, using 100k maps and Geographic Coordinate Data Base (GCDB) database.
Datum converted from NAD27 to NAD83 in compliance with WO IM 2002-066

Data updated using updated data from each field office and GCDB. Update started in Fall 2002 and was completed in Summer 2003. The field office data was current in the fall of 2002. Nevada BLM created state standards for land status in 2003. This update incorported those standards.
Inconsistencies in the updated data set where edits were made where required.

cntorgp.cntorg: US DOI Bureau of Land Management

procstep.procdesc: The BLM Land Ownership data was reviewed and compared for inconsistencies with the Ownership data maintained by the US Forest Service, the State of Nevada and Washoe County for the Sierra Front region. All of the townships that intersect Washoe County, with special attention to the inconsistent areas, were reviewed and compared with Master Title Plats. The inconsistent areas were edited using GCDB, Forest Service, and County data lines and polygons so the entire county matches the Master Title Plats.

Land ownership data was collected from the Nevada BLM district offices and combinded into a single file geodatabase. The data was put together to elimnate any overlaps or interanl gaps.
Copies of various docutments describing land status changes were given to the GIS coordinator from BLM Title Records Section. These documents were used to check for changes. Georeferenced Master Title Plats and Geographic Coordinate Data Base were used to confirm the change and spacially reference any polygons that had to be produced.
Polygons were attributed using BLM Nevada Standards for land ownership.

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

BLM makes no guarantee or warranty concerning the accuracy of information contained in the geographic data. BLM further makes no warranties, either expressed or implied as to any other matter whatsoever, including, without limitation, the condition of the product, or its fitness for any particular purpose. The burden for determining fitness for use lies entirely with the user. Although these data have been processed successfully on computers of BLM, no warranty, expressed or implied, is made by BLM regarding the use of these data on any other system, nor does the fact of distribution constitute or imply any such warranty.
